modules.description: Provides functions to process HTTP requests and responses, including a pretty-printer for error messages. Works with custom types for configuration, flow, request, response, and error handling. Used to execute request processing pipelines with custom accumulation logic.

Provides HTTP/1.1 and HTTP/2 client and server operations, including request handling, response parsing, and connection management. Works with socket-based communication, DNS resolution, TLS encryption, and HTTP message structures. Used for building standalone HTTP services or integrating HTTP capabilities into OCaml applications requiring pure OCaml dependencies.

The module offers a structured way to handle HTTP requests and responses, featuring custom types for configuration, flow, request, response, and error handling. It includes functions to process requests, manage pipelines, and pretty-print error messages. Users can execute request processing with custom accumulation logic and handle both HTTP/1.1 and HTTP/2.0 protocols. It supports secure HTTPS connections via ocaml-tls and employs the happy-eyeballs algorithm for connection establishment.
